tweets.text: The @EnvAgency investigated the "HS2 pollution incident" at Shardeloes Lake back in May 2020 and saw nothing. No example of being the most "environmentally responsible major infrastructure project in UK history". More let's hide the problems until full environmental approval. https://t.co/eDRZWPzzPL

@RachSalv @GeorgeMonbiot I've been to some of the leaking coastal landfills with @DrKateSpencer that she's been investigating. This one at Tilbury continues to leach out old rubbish, inc old car batteries. But no-one is taking responsibility for it - not the local council, nor the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/yWOXa7xpJS

@kernowbeaver @sophiepavs @BeaverTrust @TonyJuniper @pow_rebecca @ZacGoldsmith @EnvAgency Genuine question,
Did we have beavers before?
If so why did they get rid?
Thank you ‚ò∫Ô∏è

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency are useless example 5,752.

In 2020 the EA set themselves a target of "Enhancing", 2,300km of rivers. A meaningless term much loved by the board.

They achieved 1,753km. So by their measurement they missed a totally made up, completely fatuous objective.

Ho hum. https://t.co/EBi3jF0k68

Another great reason to bring back beavers. #chooselife
@BeaverTrust @TonyJuniper @pow_rebecca @ZacGoldsmith @EnvAgency https://t.co/lxJvHRTRL9

We will continue to work with @northyorkmoors, to deliver the project in spring 2021.
